greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximum connected squarefree divisor of n.
comment: A squarefree number with prime factorization prime(m_1) * ... * prime(m_k) is connected if the simple labeled graph with vertex set {m_1,...,m_k} and edges between any two vertices with a common divisor greater than 1 is connected. Connected numbers are listed in A305078.
link: Gus Wiseman, Sequences counting and encoding certain classes of multisets
example: The connected squarefree divisors of 189 are {1, 3, 7, 21}, so a(189) = 21.
xref: The maximum connected divisor of n is A327076(n).
The maximum squarefree divisor of n is A007947(n).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 20 2019
